meanings.definition: Six times as great or as numerous.
meanings.sent1: The cake was a sixfold delight with layers of chocolate and cream.
meanings.sent2: The population of the town increased sixfold after the new factory opened.
meanings.sent3: I felt sixfold happier when I found out it was a snow day.
meanings.sent4: Her smile lit up the room, making it sixfold brighter.
meanings.sent5: The mountain range stretched out before us, its beauty sixfold magnified by the setting sun.

meanings.sent1: The sixfold puzzle was challenging to put together.
meanings.sent2: The flower had a sixfold symmetry in its petals.
meanings.sent3: I bought a sixfold pack of colored pencils for my art project.
meanings.sent4: The star-shaped snowflake was a sixfold wonder of nature.
meanings.sent5: The clock had a unique design, with sixfold numbers around its face.
